Dandruff is the little scales that form when the
skin is too dry. Rub the patches well with vaseline
at night and brush the hair thoroughly next day.
Repeat until the dandruff disappears.
Brushes and combs must be kept
scrupulously clean. Wash them once
a week in a quart of cold water with
a teaspoonful of ammonia in it, using
Ivory Soap and water to complete
the task.
The Nails.
A baby's nails should be trimmed as
soon as they become long. The best imple
ment to use in cleaning the nails is a orange
wood stick, or any stick whittled to a fine
point, the other end being beveled to push down the
thin skin about the root of the nail. Steel manicure
instruments cut a furrow or channel under the nail
where the dirt accumulates.
Hang nails should be cut close with sharp scissors
and the fingers washed in a saturated solution of
boracic acid.
